description: From French pudique, from Latin pudīcus, from pudet (“it shames”).

adjectives.description: pudic (comparative more pudic, superlative most pudic)

entries.meaning: Easily ashamed, having a strong sense of shame; modest, chaste.
examples: Is it not extraordinary, by the way, that all over Europe, even in the pudic nurseries of your own country, this should be regarded as a children's book?

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Pertaining to the pudendum or external genital organs; pudendal.
